title: Anyone id this font?
content:
Seen it used on the new WWF Together app and really liked it. Anyone know what it is? Thanks :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_149.png) | 9.7 KB |
author: realmadyid

comments.content:
The font is simply called WWF and, if I'm not mistaking, has been designed by [The Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/) exclusively for WWF.  
Some alternatives: [Pill Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/betatype/pill-gothic/), [Netto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/netto/), [DIN Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-din-display-pro/), [Bariol](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.bariol.com/), [Creighton](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/creighton-pro/), [DIN Next Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/din-next/), [Almelo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113011405/http:/www.florisvoorveld.com/portfolio/free-font-fv-almelo/),
